sprint_goal: Establish CI/CD, project structures, and deliver a functional, responsive scientific calculator for anonymous users.
key_deliverables: Responsive SPA layout; Functional calculator with basic arithmetic, trig functions, and angle modes; Session-based history panel.
demo_objectives: Demonstrate a basic calculation (e.g., '5+3*2=11'); Show trig functions working in DEG and RAD modes; Show history panel populating; Show responsive layout on mobile and desktop viewports.
success_criteria: All acceptance criteria for US-001, US-061, US-007, US-012 met; All Sprint 1 tasks completed; Demonstrable MVP for anonymous users.
risk_factors: Potential delays in initial project setup and library integration.
mitigation_strategies: Use standard project templates (Vite) and well-documented libraries (MUI, Redux).
burndown_target: Linear burndown to zero by end of sprint.

sprint_goal: Implement the complete user authentication lifecycle. Establish the backend services and database schemas for all user-specific data.
epic_coverage: User Account & Data Persistence,User-Extensible Custom Modes
key_deliverables: Provisioned AWS Cognito and Lambda infrastructure; Backend JWT authentication guard; Backend CRUD APIs for History and Custom Modes; Database schemas for all user data.
demo_objectives: Show provisioned AWS resources via Terraform; Demonstrate API protection using an API client (e.g., Postman) with a valid/invalid token; Show auto-generated OpenAPI documentation.
success_criteria: All backend APIs are functional and protected; All infrastructure is defined in code and deployed; Database migrations are successful.
risk_factors: Complexity in configuring Cognito and JWT correctly; RISK-003: This sprint is on the critical path for all subsequent features.
mitigation_strategies: Use established libraries (Passport.js); Thorough integration testing of the auth guard; Early API contract definition with frontend team.
burndown_target: Linear burndown to zero by end of sprint.

sprint_name: Sprint 3: Frontend Integration & Custom Mode Wizard
sprint_goal: Connect the frontend to persistence backends. Implement the full login/registration flow and build the custom mode creation wizard.
epic_coverage: User Account & Data Persistence,User-Extensible Custom Modes
key_deliverables: Functional user registration and login UI; Persistent history for logged-in users; A complete multi-step wizard for creating custom modes.
demo_objectives: Demonstrate creating a new user account; Log in and show that history is loaded; Walk through the custom mode creation wizard and save a simple mode.
success_criteria: Users can register, log out, and log back in; History is persisted; Custom modes can be created and are saved to the backend.
risk_factors: RISK-002: Complexity of the OAuth PKCE flow implementation on the frontend.
mitigation_strategies: Use a well-vetted auth library (e.g., AWS Amplify); Allocate sufficient time for testing the auth flow.
integration_windows: Continuous integration with backend services throughout the sprint.
burndown_target: Linear burndown to zero by end of sprint.

sprint_goal: Launch the flagship user-extensible feature by building the custom mode creation wizard and the secure execution engine, allowing users to create and run their own tools.
epic_coverage: User-Extensible Custom Modes,User Account & Data Persistence
key_deliverables: Secure AWS Lambda for formula execution; Backend endpoint to orchestrate execution; Frontend UI for managing and running custom modes.
demo_objectives: Log in, navigate to the Custom Mode management screen; Launch a pre-created mode; Enter values and successfully get a calculated result; Show performance test results.
success_criteria: End-to-end custom mode execution is functional and secure; P95 latency is < 500ms; Negative security tests for the sandbox are passing.
risk_factors: RISK-001 & RISK-005: Security of the `isolated-vm` sandbox; RISK-008: Performance impact of Lambda cold starts.
mitigation_strategies: Strict resource limits on Lambda; Extensive security testing; Early performance testing to evaluate need for Provisioned Concurrency.
integration_windows: Integration between backend and Lambda service on days 3-5; Full-stack integration on days 6-8.
burndown_target: Linear burndown to zero by end of sprint.

sprint_goal: Enhance application resilience and support by implementing robust offline data synchronization.
key_deliverables: Client-side request queuing in IndexedDB; API interceptor for handling network failures; Sync manager for processing queue on reconnection; Backend conflict resolution logic.
demo_objectives: Go offline, create a new history item, go back online and show it syncs; Demonstrate the conflict resolution scenario where a server change overrides a stale local change.
success_criteria: Offline-created data is successfully persisted to the backend upon reconnection; Data conflicts are resolved predictably according to the 'last-write-wins' rule.
risk_factors: RISK-002: Complexity of offline sync logic leading to potential data loss or corruption.
mitigation_strategies: Comprehensive E2E testing with network interception; Clear UI feedback for sync status and conflicts.
burndown_target: Linear burndown to zero by end of sprint.
